data.quote: I don't think that... one gets a flash of happiness once  and never again  it is there within you  and it will come as certainly as death.
data.author: Isak Dinesen

data.quote: There is no other solution to man's progress but the day's honest work  the day's honest decisions  the day's generous utterances  and the day's good deed.
data.author: Clare Boothe Luce

data.quote: You have much more power when you are working for the right thing than when you are working for the wrong thing.
data.author: Peace Pilgrim

data.quote: I am convinced that we must train not only the head  but the heart and hand as well.
data.author: Madame Chiang Kai-Shek

data.quote: Live virtuously  and you cannot die too soon  or live too long.
data.author: Lady R. Russell

data.quote: A happy life is one which is in accordance with its own nature.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: People see God every day  they just don't recognize Him.
data.author: Pearl Bailey

data.quote: We hear voices in solitude  we never hear in the hurry and turmoil of life  we receive counsels and comforts we get under no other condition.
data.author: Amelia Barr

data.quote: Happiness is not a possession to be prized  it is a quality of thought  a state of mind.
data.author: Daphne du Maurier

data.quote: Happiness is a butterfly which  when pursued  is always beyond our grasp  but  if you will sit down quietly  may alight upon you.
data.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

data.quote: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.
data.author: Rose Wilder Lane

data.quote: To seek after beauty as an end  is a wild goose chase  a will-o'-the-wisp  because it is to misunderstand the very nature of beauty  which is the normal condition of a thing being as it should be.
data.author: Ada Bethune

data.quote: Perfect happiness is the absence of striving for happiness.
data.author: Chuang-tzu

data.quote: This will be triumph! This will be happiness! Yea  that very thing  happiness  which I have been pursuing all my life  and have never yet overtaken.
data.author: Joanna Baillie

data.quote: I don't sit around thinking that I'd like to have another husband  only another man would make me think that way.
data.author: Lauren Bacall

data.quote: Pleasure is very seldom found where it is sought. Our brightest blazes are commonly kindled by unexpected sparks.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: A sure way to lose happiness  I found  is to want it at the expense of everything else.
data.author: Bette Davis

data.quote: Those who seek happiness miss it  and those who discuss it  lack it.
data.author: Holbrook Jackson

data.quote: Inspiration never arrived when you were searching for it.
data.author: Lisa Alther

data.quote: Nothing is more hopeless than a scheme of merriment.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Happiness is never stopping to think if you are.
data.author: Palmer Sondreal

data.quote: It is the paradox of life that the way to miss pleasure is to seek it first. The very first condition of lasting happiness is that a life should be full of purpose  aiming at something outside self.
data.author: Hugh Black

data.quote: If you pursue happiness you'll never find it.
data.author: C. P. Snow

data.quote: Some of us might find happiness if we quit struggling so desperately for it.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: Seek not happiness too greedily  and be not fearful of unhappiness.
data.author: Lao-Tzu

data.quote: The man of pleasure  by a vain attempt to be more happy than any man can be  is often more miserable than most men.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: The bird of paradise alights only on the hand that does not grasp.
data.author: John Berry

data.quote: The only way to happiness is never to give happiness a thought.
data.author: Elton Trueblood

data.quote: Everyone chases after happiness  not noticing that happiness is at their heels.
data.author: Bertolt Brecht

data.quote: Seek to do good  and you will find that happiness will run after you.
data.author: James Freeman Clarke

data.quote: Deliberately to pursue happiness is not the surest way of achieving it. Seek it for its own sake and I doubt whether you will find it.
data.author: Robert J. McCracken

data.quote: Enjoyment is not a goal  it is a feeling that accompanies important ongoing activity.
data.author: Paul Goodman

data.quote: If only we'd stop trying to be happy we'd have a pretty good time.
data.author: Edith Wharton

data.quote: Most men pursue pleasure with such breathless haste that they hurry past it.
data.author: Soren Kierkegaard

data.quote: Happiness comes most to persons who seek it least  and think least about it. It is not an object to be sought  it is a state to be induced. It must follow and not lead. It must overtake you  and not you overtake it.
data.author: John Burroughs

data.quote: Happiness sneaks in through a door you didn't know you left open.
data.author: John Barrymore

data.quote: Happiness is like a cat. If you try to coax it or call it  it will avoid you. It will never come. But if you pay no attention to it and go about your business  you'll find it rubbing against your legs and jumping into your lap.
data.author: William Bennett

data.quote: One must never look for happiness: one meets it by the way.
data.author: Isabelle Eberhardt

data.quote: They seemed to come suddenly upon happiness as if they had surprised a butterfly in the winter woods.
data.author: Edith Wharton

data.quote: Happiness in this world  when it comes  comes incidentally. Make it the object of pursuit  and it leads us on a wild-goose chase  and is never attained. Follow some other object  and very possibly we may find that we have caught happiness without dreaming of it.
data.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

data.quote: Happiness and beauty are by-products. Folly is the direct pursuit of happiness and beauty.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: It is the very pursuit of happiness that thwarts happiness.
data.author: Viktor Frankl

data.quote: If you ever find happiness by hunting for it  you will find it  as the old woman did her lost spectacles  safe on her nose all the time.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: Happiness is not a goal  it is a byproduct.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: Happiness is mostly a by-product of doing what makes us feel fulfilled.
data.author: Dr. Benjamin Spock

data.quote: Happiness is something you get as a by-product in the process of making something else.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: Happiness is not a horse  you cannot harness it.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: The attainment of justice is the highest human endeavor.
data.author: Florence Ellinwood Allen

data.quote: Conscience  as I understand it  is the impulse to do the right thing because it is right  regardless of personal ends  and has nothing whatever to do with the ability to distinguish between right and wrong.
data.author: Margaret Collier Graham

data.quote: I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions.
data.author: Lillian Hellman

data.quote: The principles we live by  in business and in social life  are the most important part of happiness.
data.author: Harry Harrison

data.quote: If you aren't good at loving yourself  you will have a difficult time loving anyone  since you'll resent the time and energy you give another person that you aren't even giving to yourself.
data.author: Barbara De Angelis

data.quote: Happiness is when what you think  what you say  and what you do are in harmony.
data.author: Mahatma Gandhi

data.quote: A good message will always find a messenger.
data.author: Amelia Barr

data.quote: It's no good saying one thing and doing another.
data.author: Catherine Cookson

data.quote: There can be no happiness if the things we believe in are different from the things we do.
data.author: Freya Stark

data.quote: Let how you live your life stand for something  no matter how small and incidental it may seem.
data.author: Jodie Foster

data.quote: Happy is the man who ventures boldly to defend what he holds dear.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: It is necessary to the happiness of man that he be mentally faithful to himself.
data.author: Thomas Paine

data.quote: Happiness is that state of consciousness which proceeds from the achievement of one's values.
data.author: Ayn Rand

data.quote: It is the chiefest point of happiness that a man is willing to be what he is.
data.author: Erasmus

data.quote: Resolve to be thyself  and know that who finds himself  loses his misery.
data.author: Matthew Arnold

data.quote: There is only one history of any importance  and it is the history of what you once believed in  and the history of what you came to believe in.
data.author: Kay Boyle

data.quote: The needle of our conscience is as good a compass as any.
data.author: Ruth Wolff

data.quote: But what is happiness except the simple harmony between a man and the life he leads?
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: That kind of life is most happy which affords us most opportunities of gaining our own esteem.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Happiness is not something you get  but something you do.
data.author: Marcelene Cox

data.quote: Happiness is action.
data.author: David Thomas

data.quote: I am enjoying to a full that period of reflection which is the happiest conclusion to a life of action.
data.author: Willa Cather

data.quote: Action may not always bring happiness  but there is no happiness without action.
data.author: William James

data.quote: I want a busy life  a just mind  and a timely death.
data.author: Zora Neale Hurston

data.quote: Happiness is often the result of being too busy to be miserable.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Painting's not important. The important thing is keeping busy.
data.author: Grandma Moses

data.quote: To attain happiness in another world we need only to believe something  to secure it in this world  we must do something.
data.author: Charlotte P. Gilman

data.quote: To fill the hour  and leave no crevice ... that is happiness.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: If you observe a really happy man  you will find ... that he is happy in the course of living life twenty-four crowded hours of each day.
data.author: W. Beran Wolfe

data.quote: I find my joy of living in the fierce and ruthless battles of life.
data.author: August Strindberg

data.quote: Happiness is an expression of the soul in considered actions.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: We must be doing something to be happy.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Happiness lies in the fulfillment of the spirit through the body.
data.author: Cyril Connolly

data.quote: We must not seek happiness in peace  but in conflict.
data.author: Paul Claudel

data.quote: Happiness walks on busy feet.
data.author: Kitte Turmell

data.quote: Our actions are the springs of our happiness or misery.
data.author: Philip Skelton

data.quote: The formula for complete happiness is to be very busy.
data.author: A. Edward Newton

data.quote: The busiest man is the happiest man.
data.author: Sir Theodore Martin

data.quote: To be busy is man's only happiness.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: The only way to avoid being miserable is not to have enough leisure to wonder whether you are happy or not.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: The happiest people are those who are too busy to notice whether they are or not.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: In great moments life seems neither right nor wrong  but something greater: it seems inevitable.
data.author: Margaret Sherwood

data.quote: Happiness ... can exist only in acceptance.
data.author: Denis De Rougemont

data.quote: Knowledge of what is possible is the beginning of happiness.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: There is only one way to happiness  and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: Happiness comes from ... some curious adjustment to life.
data.author: Hugh Walpole

data.quote: Happy is he who learns to bear what he cannot change!
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes  but in liking what one has to do.
data.author: Sir James M. Barrie

data.quote: He is happy whose circumstances suit his temper  but he is more excellent who suits his temper to any circumstances.
data.author: David Hume

data.quote: Happiness is experienced when your life gives you what you are willing to accept.
data.author: Ken Keyes

data.quote: Peace of mind is that mental condition in which you have accepted the worst.
data.author: Lin Yutang

data.quote: Life is not always what one wants it to be  but to make the best of it as it is  is the only way of being happy.
data.author: Jennie Jerome Churchill

data.quote: We deem those happy who from the experience of life have learned to bear its ills  without being overcome by them.
data.author: Juvenal

data.quote: This is true joy of life-being used for a purpose that is recognized by yourself as a mighty one ... instead of being a feverish  selfish little clod of ailments and grievances  complaining that the world will not devote itself to making you happy.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Never mind your happiness  do your duty.
data.author: Will Durant

data.quote: Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
data.author: George Washington

data.quote: When we ... devote ourselves to the strict and unsparing performance of duty  then happiness comes of itself.
data.author: Wilhelm von Humboldt

data.quote: Seek happiness for its own sake  and you will not find it  seek for duty  and happiness will follow as the shadow comes with the sunshine.
data.author: Tyron Edwards

data.quote: True happiness ... is not attained through self-gratification  but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: The only true happiness comes from squandering ourselves for a purpose.
data.author: William Cowper

data.quote: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.
data.author: Phillips Brooks

data.quote: The happiest excitement in life is to be convinced that one is fighting for all one is worth on behalf of some clearly seen and deeply felt good.
data.author: Ruth Benedict

data.quote: True happiness  we are told  consists in getting out of one's self. But the point is not only to get out  you must stay out. And to stay out  you must have some absorbing errand.
data.author: Henry James

data.quote: The secret of living is to find ... the pivot of a concept on which you can make your stand.
data.author: Luigi Pirandello

data.quote: A man's happiness: to do the things proper to man.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Happy [is] the man who knows his duties!
data.author: Christian Furchtegott Gellert

data.quote: The only ones among you who will be really happy are those who will have sought and found how to serve.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: He who never sacrificed a present to a future good  or a personal to a general one  can speak of happiness only as the blind speak of color.
data.author: Horace Mann

data.quote: There is no happiness except in the realization that we have accom plished something.
data.author: Henry Ford

data.quote: I believe half the unhappiness in life comes from people being afraid to go straight at things.
data.author: William J. Locke

data.quote: The full-grown modern human being ... is conscious of touching the highest pinnacle of fulfillment... when he is consumed in the service of an idea  in the conquest of the goal pursued.
data.author: R. Briffault

data.quote: Happiness is essentially a state of going somewhere  wholeheartedly  one-directionally  without regret or reservation.
data.author: William H. Sheldon

data.quote: Happiness is the overcoming of not unknown obstacles toward a known goal.
data.author: L. Ron Hubbard

data.quote: Give a man health and a course to steer  and he'll never stop to trouble about whether he's happy or not.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Having a goal is a state of happiness.
data.author: E. J. Bartek

data.quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achieve ment and the thrill of creative effort.
data.author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

data.quote: Without duty  life is soft and bone less.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: It is always the simple that produces the marvelous.
data.author: Amelia Barr

data.quote: Happiness consists not in having much  but in being content with little.
data.author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

data.quote: Man is meant for happiness and this happiness is in him  in the satisfaction of the daily needs of his existence.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.quote: I have had more than half a century of such happiness. A great deal of worry and sorrow  too  but never a worry or a sorrow that was not offset by a purple iris  a lark  a bluebird  or a dewy morning glory.
data.author: Mary McLeod Bethune

data.quote: A multitude of small delights constitute happiness.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions-the little  soon-forgotten charities of a kiss or smile  a kind look  a heart-felt compliment  and the countless infinitesimals of pleasurable and genial feeling.
data.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

data.quote: For me it is sufficient to have a corner by my hearth  a book and a friend  and a nap undisturbed by creditors or grief.
data.author: Fernandez de Andrada

data.quote: A happy life is made up of little things ... a gift sent  a letter written  a call made  a recommendation given  transportation provided  a cake made  a book lent  a check sent.
data.author: Carol Holmes

data.quote: Yes  there is a Nirvanah  it is in leading your sheep to a green pasture  and in putting your child to sleep  and in writing the last line of your poem.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: First health  then wealth  then pleasure  and do not owe anything to anybody.
data.author: Catherine the Great

data.quote: I know well that happiness is in little things.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Sooner or later we all discover that the important moments in life are not the advertised ones  not the birthdays  the graduations  the weddings  not the great goals achieved. The real milestones are less prepossessing. They come to the door of memory.
data.author: Susan B. Anthony

data.quote: There is nothing like staying at home for real comfort.
data.author: Jane Austen

data.quote: I don't think about whether people will remember me or not. I've been an okay person. I've learned a lot. I've taught people a thing or two. That's what's important.
data.author: Julia Child

data.quote: What would life be without art? Science prolongs life. To consist of what-eating  drinking  and sleeping? What is the good of living longer if it is only a matter of satisfying the requirements that sustain life? All this is nothing without the charm of art.
data.author: Sarah Bernhardt

data.quote: It is by studying little things that we attain the great knowledge of having as little misery and as much happiness as possible.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: The happiest people I have known in this world have been the Saints-and  after these  the men and women who get immediate and conscious enjoyment from little things.
data.author: Hugh Walpole

data.quote: The little things are infinitely the most important.
data.author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

data.quote: We women ought to put first things first. Why should we mind if men have their faces on the money  as long as we get our hands on it?
data.author: Ivy Baker Priest

data.quote: Eating is not merely a material pleasure. Eating well gives a spectacular joy to life and contributes immensely to goodwill and happy companionship. It is of great importance to the morale.
data.author: Elsa Schiapirelli

data.quote: I am beginning to learn that it is the sweet  simple things of life which are the real ones after all.
data.author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

data.quote: Happiness consists more in small conveniences or pleasures that occur every day  than in great pieces of good fortune that happen but seldom.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: The happiness of most people is not ruined by great catastrophes or fatal errors  but by the repetition of slowly destructive little things.
data.author: Ernest Dimnet

data.quote: Enjoy the little things  for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
data.author: Robert Brault

data.quote: Why not learn to enjoy the little things-there are so many of them.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Anyone who's a great kisser I'm always interested in.
data.author: Cher

data.quote: Moderation. Small helpings. Sample a little bit of everything. These are the secrets of happiness and good health.
data.author: Julia Child

data.quote: The best things are nearest: breath in your nostrils  light in your eyes  flowers at your feet  duties at your hand  the path of God just before you. Then do not grasp at the stars  but do life's plain  common work as it comes  certain that daily duties and daily bread are the sweetest things of life.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: In violent and chaotic times such as these  our only chance for survival lies in creating our own little islands of sanity and order  in making little havens of our homes.
data.author: Susan Kaufman

data.quote: Small kindnesses  small courtesies  small considerations  habitually practiced in our social intercourse  give a greater charm to the character than the display of great talents and accomplishments.
data.author: Mary Ann Kelty

data.quote: For most of life  nothing wonderful happens. If you don't enjoy getting up and working and finishing your work and sitting down to a meal with family or friends  then the chances are you're not going to be very happy. If someone bases his happiness or unhappiness on major events like a great new job  huge amounts of money  a flawlessly happy marriage or a trip to Paris  that person isn't going to be happy much of the time. If  on the other hand  happiness depends on a good breakfast  flowers in the yard  a drink or a nap  then we are more likely to live with quite a bit of happiness.
data.author: Andy Rooney

data.quote: The mere sense of living is joy enough.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: The true way to soften one's troubles is to solace those of others.
data.author: Madame De Maintenon

data.quote: To complain that life has no joys while there is a single creature whom we can relieve by our bounty  assist by our counsels or enliven by our presence  is... just as rational as to die of thirst with the cup in our hands.
data.author: Thomas Fitzosborne

data.quote: We learn the inner secret of happiness when we learn to direct our inner drives  our interest  and our attention to something besides ourselves.
data.author: Ethel Percy Andrus

data.quote: Little deeds of kindness  little words of love  Help to make earth happy like the heaven up above.
data.author: Julia A. Fletcher Carney

data.quote: In about the same degree as you are helpful  you will be happy.
data.author: Karl Reiland

data.quote: Hire the best. Pay them fairly. Communicate frequently. Provide challenges and rewards. Believe in them. Get out of their way and they'll knock your socks off.
data.author: Mary Ann Allison

data.quote: Treat a horse like a woman and a woman like a horse. And they'll both win for you.
data.author: Elizabeth Arden

data.quote: Invest in the human soul. Who knows  it might be a diamond in the rough.
data.author: Mary McLeod Bethune

data.quote: All the goodness  beauty  and perfection of a human being belong to the one who knows how to recognize these qualities.
data.author: Georgette Leblanc

data.quote: You cannot always have happiness  but you can always give happiness.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The nice thing about teamwork is that you always have others on your side.
data.author: Margaret Carty

data.quote: No one can sincerely try to help another without helping himself.
data.author: Charles Dudley Warner

data.quote: Happiness is a by-product of helping others.
data.author: Denny Miller

data.quote: The most exquisite pleasure is giving pleasure to others.
data.author: Jean de la Bruyere

data.quote: No man can live happily who regards himself alone  who turns everything to his own advantage. Thou must live for another if thou wishest to live for thyself.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Scatter seeds of kindness everywhere you go  Scatter bits of courtesy-watch them grow and grow. Gather buds of friendship  keep them till full-blown  You will find more happiness than you have ever known.
data.author: Amy R. Raabe

data.quote: If all our happiness is bound up entirely in our personal circumstances  it is difficult not to demand of life more than it has to give.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: No man is more cheated than the selfish man.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: The habit of being uniformly considerate toward others will bring increased happiness to you.
data.author: Grenville Kleiser

data.quote: If you have not often felt the joy of doing a kind act  you have neglected much  and most of all yourself.
data.author: A. Neilen

data.quote: We cannot hold a torch to light another's path without brightening our own.
data.author: Ben Sweetland

data.quote: Life becomes harder for us when we live for others  but it also becomes richer and happier.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: Happiness ... consists in giving  and in serving others.
data.author: Henry Drummond

data.quote: Pleasure is a reciprocal  no one feels it who does not at the same time give it. To be pleased  one must please.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: He that despiseth his neighbor sin-neth  but he that hath mercy on the poor  happy is he.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Instinct teaches us to look for happiness outside ourselves.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: A bit of fragrance always clings to the hand that gives you roses.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: When you dig another out of their troubles  you find a place to bury your own.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: One thing I know: the only ones among you who will be really happy are those who will have sought and found how to serve.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: Caring about others  running the risk of feeling  and leaving an impact on people  brings happiness.
data.author: Rabbi Harold Kushner

data.quote: The entire sum of existence is the magic of being needed by just one person.
data.author: Vi Putnam

data.quote: One of the things I keep learning is that the secret of being happy is doing things for other people.
data.author: Dick Gregory

data.quote: Make one person happy each day and in forty years you will have made 14 600 human beings happy for a little time  at least.
data.author: Charley Willey

data.quote: The most satisfying thing in life is to have been able to give a large part of oneself to others.
data.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

data.quote: To be kind to all  to like many and love a few  to be needed and wanted by those we love  is certainly the nearest we can come to happiness.
data.author: Mary Roberts Rinehart

data.quote: Seldom can the heart be lonely  If it seeks a lonelier still  Self-forgetting  seeking only Emptier cups of love to fill.
data.author: Frances Ridley Havergal

data.quote: The older you get  the more you realize that kindness is synonymous with happiness.
data.author: Lionel Barrymore

data.quote: There is no happiness in having or in getting  but only in giving.
data.author: Henry Drummond

data.quote: Make happy those who are near  and those who are far will come.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: True happiness consists in making others happy.
data.author: Hindu proverb

data.quote: All who would win joy  must share it  happiness was born a twin.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: Happiness is not so much in having as sharing. We make a living by what we get  but we make a life by what we give.
data.author: Norman MacEwan

data.quote: Happiness quite unshared can scarcely be called happiness  it has no taste.
data.author: Charlotte Bronte

data.quote: Happiness is a sunbeam which may pass through a thousand bosoms without losing a particle of its original ray  nay  when it strikes on a kindred heart  like the converged light on a mirror  it reflects itself with redoubled brightness. It is not perfected till it is shared.
data.author: Jane Porter

data.quote: The tourist may complain of other tourists  but he would be lost without them.
data.author: Agnes Repplier

data.quote: Unshared joy is an unlighted candle.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: A joy that's shared is a joy made double.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: The human heart  at whatever age  opens only to the heart that opens in return.
data.author: Maria Edgeworth

data.quote: Happiness is the cheapest thing in the world ... when we buy it for someone else.
data.author: Paul Flemming

data.quote: To get the full value of a joy you must have somebody to divide it with.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: When someone does something good  applaud! You will make two people happy.
data.author: Samuel Goldwyn

data.quote: Happiness is not perfected until it is shared.
data.author: Jane Porter

data.quote: Happiness ... is achieved only by making others happy.
data.author: Stuart Cloete

data.quote: Our Thoughts Determine Our Happiness High above hate I dwell  0 storms! Farewell.
data.author: Louise Imogen Guiney

data.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: 1 am happy and content because I think I am.
data.author: Alain-Rene Lesage

data.quote: All happiness is in the mind.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Happiness is not a matter of events  it depends upon the tides of the mind.
data.author: Alice Meynell

data.quote: A happy life consists in tranquility of mind.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: The real winners in life are the people who look at every situation with an expectation that they can make it work or make it better.
data.author: Barbara Pletcher

data.quote: A man's as miserable as he thinks he is.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: The happiest person is the person who thinks the most interesting thoughts.
data.author: William Lyon Phelps

data.quote: Unhappiness indicates wrong thinking  just as ill health indicates a bad regimen.
data.author: Paul Bourget

data.quote: He is happy that knoweth not himself to be otherwise.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: The greater part of our happiness or misery depends on our dispositions  and not our circumstances.
data.author: Martha Washington

data.quote: Happiness does not depend on outward things  but on the way we see them.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.quote: Happiness will never be any greater than the idea we have of it.
data.author: Maurice Maeterlinck

data.quote: We are never so happy or so unhappy as we think.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: Misery is almost always the result of thinking.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness.
data.author: Bernard de Fontenelle

data.quote: It isn't our position  but our disposition  that makes us happy.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A man's happiness or unhappiness depends as much on his temperament as on his destiny.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: I went back to being an amateur  in the sense of somebody who loves what she is doing. If a professional loses the love of work  routine sets in  and that's the death of work and life.
data.author: Ada Bethune

data.quote: The high prize of life  the crowning fortune of man  is to be born with a bias to some pursuit which finds him in employment and happiness.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The medals don't mean anything and the glory doesn't last. It's all about your happiness. The rewards are going to come  but my happiness is just loving the sport and having fun performing.
data.author: Jackie Joyner-Kersee

data.quote: The road to happiness lies in two simple principles: find what it is that interests you and that you can do well  and when you find it put your whole soul into it-every bit of energy and ambition and natural ability you have.
data.author: John D. Rockefeller III

data.quote: They are happy men whose natures sort with their vocations.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: Happiness consists in the full employment of our faculties in some pursuit.
data.author: Harriet Martineau

data.quote: The happy people are those who are producing something.
data.author: William Ralph Inge

data.quote: Congenial labor is the secret of happiness.
data.author: Arthur Christopher Benson

data.quote: To find out what one is fitted to do  and to secure an opportunity to do it  is the key to happiness.
data.author: John Dewey

data.quote: If I were to suggest a general rule for happiness  I would say "Work a little harder  Work a little longer  Work!"
data.author: Frederick H. Ecker

data.quote: To make a man happy  fill his hands with work.
data.author: Frederick E. Crane

data.quote: Work is the true elixir of life. The busiest man is the happiest man.
data.author: Sir Theodore Martin

data.quote: Happiness ... loves to see men work. She loves sweat  weariness  self-sacrifice. She will not be found in the palaces  but lurking in cornfields and factories  and hovering over littered desks.
data.author: David Grayson

data.quote: Every job has drudgery. ... The first secret of happiness is the recognition of this fundamental fact.
data.author: M. C. Mcintosh

data.quote: All happiness depends on courage and work.
data.author: Honore de Balzac

data.quote: There is work that is work and there is play that is play  there is play that is work and work that is play. And in only one of these lie happiness.
data.author: Gelett Burgess

data.quote: Employment... is so essential to human happiness that indolence is justly considered the mother of misery.
data.author: Robert Burton

data.quote: Happiness comes only when we push our brains and hearts to the farthest reaches of which we are capable.
data.author: Leo C. Rosten

data.quote: A man is relieved and gay when he has put his heart into his work and done his best.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: There is certainly no greater happiness than to be able to look back on a life usefully and virtuously employed  to trace our own progress in existence by such tokens as excite neither shame nor sorrow.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Continuity of purpose is one of the most essential ingredients of happiness in the long run  and for most men this comes chiefly through their work.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Blessed is he who has found his work  let him ask no other blessedness. He has a work  a life-purpose. ... Get your happiness out of your work or you will never know what real happiness is. ... Even in the meanest sorts of labor  the whole soul of a man is composed into a kind of real harmony the instant he sets himself to work.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Man is happy only as he finds a work worth doing-and does it well.
data.author: E. Merrill Root

data.quote: Life without absorbing occupation is hell.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Few persons realize how much of their happiness  such as it is  is dependent upon their work.
data.author: John Burroughs

data.quote: Joy is the will which labours  which overcomes obstacles  which knows triumph.
data.author: William Butler Yeats

data.quote: Get happiness out of your work or you may never know what happiness is.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: When men are rightly occupied  their amusement grows out of their work  as the color-petals out of a fruitful flower.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Parents  however old they and we may grow to be  serve among other things to shield us from a sense of our doom. As long as they are around  we can avoid the fact of our mortality  we can still be innocent children.
data.author: Jane Howard

data.quote: You leave home to seek your fortune and  when you get it  you go home and share it with your family.
data.author: Anita Baker

data.quote: Sometimes the strength of motherhood is greater than natural laws.
data.author: Barbara Kingsolver

data.quote: He is happiest  be he king or peasant  who finds peace in his home.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: My child looked at me and I looked back at him in the delivery room  and I realized that out of a sea of infinite possibilities it had come down to this: a specific person  born on the hottest day of the year  conceived on a Christmas Eve  made by his father and me miraculously from scratch.
data.author: Anna Quindlen
